Now of the things which we have spoken <FI>this is<Fi> the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;
A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.<RF>of the sanctuary: or, of holy things<Rf>
For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore <FI>it is<Fi> of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.
For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:<RF>thereâ€¦: or, they are priests<Rf>

Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, <FO>See,<Fo> saith he, <FO><FI>that<Fi> thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.<Fo><CM>
But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.<RF>covenant: or, testament<Rf>
For if that first <FI>covenant<Fi> had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.
For finding fault with them, he saith, <FO>Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:<Fo>

<FO>Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.<Fo>

<FO>For this <FI>is<Fi> the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:<Fo><RF>put: Gr. give<Rf><RF>in: or, upon<Rf>
<FO>And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.<Fo>
<FO>For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.<Fo>
In that he saith, A new <FI>covenant<Fi>, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old <FI>is<Fi> ready to vanish away.<CM>
